abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Liberia Infrastructure
            Rehabilitation Project for Liberia were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory, risk to development outcome
            was moderate, Bank performance was moderately satisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned include: the procurement lessons learned in
            the International Competitive Bidding (ICB) for works and
            large value consulting contracts for post-conflict
            environments are finding interested contractors and
            consultants with adequate capacity and experience to work in
            a fragile state; engineering estimates for critical works
            and installations in post-conflict countries, especially
            those to be bid under ICB, should appreciate, recognize and
            accommodate the influence of potential bidders'
            perceived risks and uncertainties in the post-conflict
            environment, in order to provide realistic working estimates
            for critical post conflict infrastructure to facilitate
            effective budgeting; and there is need for early
            identification of qualified firms in the market, relative to
            required specialized and or critical services and engage
            their interest. Wherever possible, consider an amalgamation
            of resources into one sizeable project. Project design
            lessons learned are: it is important not to design projects
            that are overambitious in scope, since this may lead to
            critical activities not being implemented by others and
            increasing risks in a fragile situation. A well laid out
            structure for institutional collaboration in a
            well-coordinated manner for all project activities is
            fundamental to effective implementation of such projects,
            especially for multiple stakeholders. Supervision of
            specialist assignments should not be entrusted to a
            governmental unit until it has demonstrated previously that
            it is capable of handling the task. Extraordinary efforts
            need to be made to attract contractors and consultants to a
            country during the project preparation phase. Timely
            oversight mechanism and support is extremely necessary in a
            post-conflict environment where the circumstances are fast
            changing and evolving, particularly, on problems
            identification and early reporting by the technical staff
            during implementation.
